page.title: 03Farming Crosthwaite'area'
page.content: {High Yews:}a typical farm:70 acres,30 milking cows,100 breeding ewes producing 170 lambs. {Reuben Parsons'daily diary:Spring'85. 4am. Rise,wash,dress,have coffee and sandwich.4:15am.Check livestock 4:20am Bottle milk for daily round. 5:15am. Load up milk pickup.Deliver to Crosthwaite.6:45am Return home,coffee, change into work clothes.7am.Milk cows.8am.Clean out byres.Feed calves. 9am.Breakfast.Feed sheep.General farm husbandry.11am.Coffee/toast.Unload milk pickup from Winster/Lyth Valley delivery.Feed/clean out cattle at Levens.Load trailer with hay/return home.1_2pm. Lunch. Catch up on bookwork.2pm_4:30pm. General farm maintenance.Empty manure spreader.Feed horses.Tea/sandwich.Milking,feed/clean out calves,check lambing sheep.7pm supper.9:30pm.Check livestock.
